title: Configuration Guide - Example Documentation
content:
Configuration Guide

Learn how to configure the Example Platform for your needs.

Configuration File

The platform uses a JSON configuration file. Create a config.json in your project root:

{
  "debug": false,
  "host": "0.0.0.0",
  "port": 8000,
  "database": {
    "url": "postgresql://localhost/mydb",
    "pool_size": 10
  },
  "cache": {
    "enabled": true,
    "ttl": 3600
  },
  "logging": {
    "level": "INFO",
    "file": "app.log"
  }
}

Environment Variables

You can also configure using environment variables:

  • EXAMPLE_DEBUG - Enable debug mode
  • EXAMPLE_HOST - Server host
  • EXAMPLE_PORT - Server port
  • EXAMPLE_DATABASE_URL - Database connection URL

Programmatic Configuration

Configure programmatically in your code:

from example import Platform, Configuration

config = Configuration()
config.set('debug', True)
config.set('host', 'localhost')
config.set('port', 8080)

platform = Platform()
platform.initialize(config)

Configuration Priority

Configuration is loaded in this order (later overrides earlier):

  1. Default values
  2. Configuration file
  3. Environment variables
  4. Programmatic settings
